author: Staff Reporter
text:
It comes as no surprise that P. Karthika, a class 3 student of Chennai Corporation School Taramani, when asked what her favourite subject is immediately says: “Mathematics.”

The eight-year-old has secured the ninth place in the Mathematics Olympiad organised by the Science Olympiad Foundation. She was one among thousands of other students who attempted the examination across the globe, the event organisers said.

Karthika gave her test from Chennai.

Her teacher Swati Nandy was delegated to teach her class as part of the of Teach for India fellowship programme. Ms. Nandy said: Karthika has always been willing to learn.

“We noticed that she developed a special interest for mathematics and thoroughly enjoyed learning it.”

Karthika is among the many students coming from underprivilidged backgrounds. Her father is a daily wage earner, working for a clothing store, while her mother is a homemaker.

“I have spent the last two years teaching in this school as a part of the fellowship programme. The students here are inspired to learn more and it has been a great learning experience for me as a teacher. They are as motivated as students from privileged backgrounds. All they need is to be given the right opportunities and platform to exhibit their talent. This happened in Karthika’s case,” Ms. Swathi added.

She was one among thousands who attempted the examination across the globe
title: Class 3 student secures top rank at Mathematics Olympiad
